page.title: 01CLIFTON HAMPDEN, OXFORDSHIRE
page.content: This area, most of it lying in a loop in the River Thames, is one of great contrasts. Predominately it is rural England. Most of it covered by farms or woodland. Few people live here. In the midst of this rural scene lies the Culham laboratory of the United Kingdom Atomic Energy Authority. On the same site are the buildings which house the Joint European Torus (JET) which is the largest single project of the co-ordinated research programmme of the European Atomic Energy Community. The north western corner of the block is separated from the rest by the River Thames. Here the character of the landscape is different again. A number of disused gravel pits support wildlife but the area is in the process of being redeveloped by the Central Electricity Generating Board.
